name: Childhood Diarrhea

primary.name: diarrhea
primary.description: Frequent loose or watery stools (3 or more in 24 hours)

primary.name: dehydration
primary.description: Signs of fluid loss: sunken eyes, dry mouth, reduced urine

secondary.name: loss_of_appetite
secondary.description: Refusal to eat or reduced feeding

risk_factors.description: Lack of access to clean drinking water
Lack of exclusive breastfeeding in first 6 months

clinical: Three or more loose or watery stools in 24 hours

dehydration_assessment.no_dehydration: Alert, drinks normally, skin pinch goes back quickly
dehydration_assessment.some_dehydration: Restless, irritable, drinks eagerly, skin pinch goes back slowly
dehydration_assessment.severe_dehydration: Lethargic, unable to drink, skin pinch goes back very slowly

severe.medication: IV Ringer's Lactate or Normal Saline
severe.notes: For severe dehydration, immediate hospital treatment

supportive_care: Give extra fluids including ORS after each loose stool
Return if condition worsens or danger signs appear

complications.name: malnutrition
complications.description: Worsening nutritional status from repeated episodes

complications.name: electrolyte_imbalance
complications.description: Dangerous shifts in sodium, potassium levels

prevention: Hand hygiene with soap and water

en.what_is: Diarrhea is frequent loose or watery stools, often caused by infection.
en.symptoms: Watch for watery stools, vomiting, sunken eyes, dry mouth, and decreased urination.
en.treatment: Give ORS after every loose stool and zinc for 10-14 days. Continue breastfeeding.
en.prevention: Wash hands with soap, use clean water, and ensure proper sanitation.
en.when_to_return: Return immediately if child cannot drink, has blood in stool, high fever, or becomes very sleepy.

sw.what_is: Kuharisha ni kinyesi kioevu mara kwa mara, mara nyingi kunasababishwa na maambukizi.
sw.symptoms: Angalia kinyesi cha maji, kutapika, macho yaliyozama, kinywa kavu, na mkojo kupungua.
sw.treatment: Mpe ORS baada ya kila kinyesi koevu na zinki kwa siku 10-14. Endelea kunyonyesha.
sw.prevention: Osha mikono kwa sabuni, tumia maji safi, na hakikisha usafi wa mazingira.
sw.when_to_return: Rudi mara moja ikiwa mtoto hawezi kunywa, ana damu kwenye kinyesi, homa kali, au analala sana.

red_flags: Sunken eyes with slow skin pinch

follow_up.persistent: If diarrhea continues beyond 14 days (persistent diarrhea)

classification.no_dehydration: Plan A: Treat diarrhea at home
classification.some_dehydration: Plan B: Treat some dehydration with ORS
classification.severe_dehydration: Plan C: Treat severe dehydration quickly
